results.title: Dispute
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, Leon Clore and Fred Moore
results.brief_description: A study of a typical industrial dispute and the real reason behind it. A personal incident between an operative and a foreman grows, until the whole factory is brought to a stand-still. Concentrates in turn on the operative, the foreman, the shop steward and the factory manager, showing how each of them came to take the attitude he did and how each felt he had no alternative and was unable to withdraw.

results.title: Dispensing a cure
results.brief_description: One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region. Ian Darling and Doug McColl have each practised pharmacy for over forty years in the Warracknabeal district. In this film they recall the era when most drugs were hand-made on the premises, generally from raw materials. Ian also tells of the mysterious medicine jar labelled ‘ADT’ and of an old-fashioned coin-operated machine for a self administered electric shock.

results.title: Disney's very merry Christmas songs
results.brief_description: Join your favourite Disney characters in these traditional Christmas songs including “Deck the Halls”, “Jingle Bells”, “Joy to the World”, “Let it Snow!”, “Sleigh Ride”, “Parade of the Wooden Soldiers”, “Winter Wonderland”, “Here Comes Santa Claus”, “Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer”, “Silent Night” and “We Wish You a Merry Christmas”. The words of the carols appear on screen so you can sing along.

results.title: Disney's haunted Halloween
results.brief_description: Goofy learns from an animated Jack O’Lantern that Halloween is a great time to find out about old time holiday traditions and superstitions. Looks at why people dress in costumes and how “trick” or “treating” started. The program also contains appropriate warnings about cautious behaviour during such a festive time.

results.title: Disney's best: the fabulous '50s
results.brief_description: Walt Disney and his staff of animators the 1950s were marked by transitions and experimentation, resulting in some of the most revolutionary cartoons ever released. The technique of “limited animation” and sylised design won “Toot, whistle, plunk and boom” the Academy Award for Best Cartoon Short Subject of 1953. Breakthrough results were also achieved in “Noah’s Ark”, which utilised stop-action photography and the animation of stick figures composed on pencils, cork and pipe cleaners. Titles included are: “Lambert, the sheepish lion” 1951, “Pigs is pigs” 1954, “Toot, whistle, plunk and boom” 1953, and “Noah’s Ark” 1959.

results.title: Dishwashing by hand
results.creator_credit: Los Angeles City Health Department, Donald F. Grant and Dale W. Imus
results.brief_description: A film which emphasises the importance of hygienic dish-washing, showing that for health and attractive presentation in either large or small cafeterias, dishes must be scraped, pre-rinsed, washed, rinsed and drained. Both mechanical and hand methods are illustrated.

results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army

results.title: Discussion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Intending to stimulate language development and curiosity, and enlargement of concepts, understanding, the teacher introduces some human vertebrae and discusses their relation to the human form, allowing the children to handle the bones. For preschool eduction.
